name: Youth Services
description: AICRC offers an array of services targeted at nurturing the positive development of Native youth. Youth Services departments include, the Indian Education Center (IEC) after-school academic and cultural program; the Tobacco Use Prevention Education (TUPE) program; and the Preparing Oakland Native Youth (PONY) program for older youth and youth not in school. - After-school academic and cultural program for Oakland Native students in grades 6-12 - Guidance and support for older youth (ages 14-21)
fullDescription: AICRC offers an array of services targeted at nurturing the positive development of Native youth. Youth Services departments include, the Indian Education Center (IEC) after-school academic and cultural program; the Tobacco Use Prevention Education (TUPE) program; and the Preparing Oakland Native Youth (PONY) program for older youth and youth not in school. - After-school academic and cultural program for Oakland Native students in grades 6-12 - Guidance and support for older youth (ages 14-21)
whatTheyOffer: AICRC offers an array of services targeted at nurturing the positive development of Native youth. Youth Services departments include, the Indian Education Center (IEC) after-school academic and cultural program; the Tobacco Use Prevention Education (TUPE) program; and the Preparing Oakland Native Youth (PONY) program for older youth and youth not in school. - After-school academic and cultural program for Oakland Native students in grades 6-12 - Guidance and support for older youth (ages 14-21)
howToGetIt: To be eligible, students must self-Identify as Native American and attend a school in Oakland or Alameda. Call mainline for information on enrollment.
